snippet: The president of Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center, Dr. Craig B. Thompson, is in a billion-dollar dispute with his former workplace over accusations that he walked away with research.
abstract: Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center president Dr Craig B Thompson is in a billion-dollar dispute with his former workplace, a cancer institute at the University of Pennsylvania, over accusations that he walked away with research; dispute reflects the importance that academic research centers now place on turning discoveries made on their campuses into sources of revenue.
lead_paragraph: The president of Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center, Dr. Craig B. Thompson, is in a billion-dollar dispute with his former workplace over accusations that he walked away with research.

headline.seo: Cancer Center, in Suit, Claims Ex-Official Took Research
headline.main: Sloan-Kettering Chief Is Accused of Taking Research
headline.print_headline: A Prominent Cancer Center Chief Is Accused of Taking Research

keywords.value: Abramson, Leonard and Madlyn, Familly Cancer Research Institute
keywords.name: organizations
